scheme_name: Stipends to Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC
sub_categories: Education and training grants, fellowship, stipend
brief_description: The scheme "Stipends to Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Dept., Gujarat, supports education for Socially and Educationally Backward Classes students by providing a monthly stipend of ₹400/-.
detailed_description: The scheme "Stipends to Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote inclusive education by financially supporting students from Socially and Educationally Backward Classes pursuing technical and vocational education after SSC. The initiative offers a stipend of ₹400/- per month to aid the academic progress and reduce the dropout rate among underprivileged youth. The scheme is implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department. It specifically benefits those enrolled in professional or Government ITI courses and belonging to families with an annual income not exceeding ₹6,00,000/-.
benefits: Stipend: A monthly stipend of ₹400/- is given to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes students for one year of recognized professional and Government ITI courses.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant should belong to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes. The applicant should be a student who has passed the Secondary School Certificate (SSC) examination. The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized professional or Government Industrial Training Institute (ITI) course. The applicant's individual and family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/- per annum.
